speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Tomorrow is the joyful day, Audrey. Tomorrow

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: will we be married.

speaker: AUDREY
text: I do desire it with all my heart, and I hope it is

speaker: AUDREY
text: no dishonest desire to desire to be a woman of the

speaker: AUDREY
text: world.

speaker: AUDREY
text: Here come two of the banished duke’s pages.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PAGE
text: Well met, honest gentleman.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: By my troth, well met. Come, sit, sit, and

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: a song.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PAGE
text: We are for you. Sit i’ th’ middle.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PAGE
text: Shall we clap into ’t roundly, without

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PAGE
text: hawking or spitting or saying we are hoarse, which

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PAGE
text: are the only prologues to a bad voice?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PAGE
text: I’ faith, i’ faith, and both in a tune like

speaker:
SECOND
               
              PAGE
text: two gypsies on a horse.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: Truly, young gentlemen, though there

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: was no great matter in the ditty, yet the note was

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: very untunable.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PAGE
text: You are deceived, sir. We kept time. We lost

speaker:
FIRST
               
              PAGE
text: not our time.

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: By my troth, yes. I count it but time lost

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: to hear such a foolish song. God be wi’ you, and

speaker: TOUCHSTONE
text: God mend your voices.—Come, Audrey.
